documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
st detailed information of Babbage’s
Analytical Engine [a digital computer planned in the 1830s] comes from a
memoir by Lady Lovelace. In it she states, “The Analytical Engine has no
pretensions to originateanything. It can do whatever we know how to order itto
perform” (her italics). This statement is quoted by Hartree who adds: “This
does not imply that it may not be possible to construct electronic equipment
which will ‘think for itself,’ or in which, in biological terms, one could set up
a c
